creator: bzbarsky@mit.edu
summary: Remove the need for hacky skipgen worker descriptors

assigned_to_detail.name: bzbarsky@mit.edu
assigned_to_detail.real_name: Boris Zbarsky [:bz] (no decent commit message means r-)

comments.text:
We only need these for cases when an overload for a method on a worker binding takes some type that's not exposed in workers.

But we can just filter such overloads out during codegen.  Patch coming up.
comments.author: bzbarsky@mit.edu

comments.text:
Created attachment 8549171
Filter out overloads with non-worker-exposed arguments when generating worker bindings
comments.author: bzbarsky@mit.edu

comments.text:
Comment on attachment 8549177
Filter out overloads with non-worker-exposed arguments when generating worker bindings

Review of attachment 8549177:
-----------------------------------------------------------------

Nice.

::: dom/bindings/Codegen.py
@@ +6874,5 @@
> +            if descriptor.workers:
> +                # Filter out the signatures that should not be exposed in a worker
> +                signatures = filter(
> +                    lambda sig: all(typeExposedInWorkers(arg.type)
> +                                    for arg in sig[1]),

Shouldn't we care about the return value?
comments.author: peterv@propagandism.org

comments.text: Which return value?  The return value of a lambda in Python is the last expression in the lambda, no?
comments.author: bzbarsky@mit.edu

comments.text: I meant for members returning a non-worker object (sig[0]).
comments.author: peterv@propagandism.org

comments.text:
> I meant for members returning a non-worker object (sig[0]).

Oh, I see.  That actually can't happen: we have checks in the parser that the return type's exposure set is a superset of the member's exposure set.

So for example if I add an overload like this to XMLHttpRequest:

  Document send(XMLHttpRequest data);

I get an IDL parser error:

  WebIDL.WebIDLError: error: Overload returns a type that is not exposed everywhere where the method is exposed, /Users/bzbarsky/mozilla/inbound/mozilla/dom/webidl/XMLHttpRequest.webidl line 106:2
comments.author: bzbarsky@mit.edu

comments.text: I'll add an assert, though, in case we ever change that.
comments.author: bzbarsky@mit.edu

comments.text:
# Filter out the signatures that should not be exposed in a
                # worker.  The IDL parser enforces the return value being
                # exposed correctly, but we have to check the argument types.
                assert all(typeExposedInWorkers(sig[0]) for sig in signatures)
                signatures = filter(
                    lambda sig: all(typeExposedInWorkers(arg.type)
                                    for arg in sig[1]),
                    signatures)
comments.author: bzbarsky@mit.edu

comments.text: That caught an issue: InstallEvent and InstallPhaseEvent are exposed in Window only but have workers:True descriptors for some reason that escapes me, so fail that assert for the constructor.  I see no reason for that workers:True in the descriptors.  Nikhil, any objections to me just removing it?
comments.author: bzbarsky@mit.edu

comments.text: You can remove them, I won't be able to land Bug 1121688 for a couple of days. ServiceWorkers are preffed off, so any changes you make won't matter.
comments.author: nsm.nikhil@gmail.com
